IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: ANDERSON PHYSICIAN ALLIANCE, INC. OFFERS FAMILY PRACTICE AND SPECIALTY CLINICS TO PROVIDE QUALITY HEALTHCARE FOR EAST MISSISSIPPI AND WEST ALABAMA.
IRS990.MissionDesc: SEE SCHEDULE O:ANDERSON PHYSICIAN ALLIANCE, INC. IS ORGANIZED EXCLUSIVELY FOR CHARITABLE AND EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES. THE SPECIFIC PURPOSES AND OBJECTIVES OF THE CORPORATION SHALL INCLUDE BUT NOT BE LIMITED TO EMPLOYING PHYSICIANS AND OTHER MEDICAL PERSONNEL TO CARRY OUT THE PURPOSES AND OBJECTIVES OF ANDERSON REGIONAL MEDICAL CENTER, AS FOLLOWS:1.) TO ESTABLISH AND MAINTAIN AN INSTITUTION OR INSTITUTIONS, WITHIN OR WITHOUT THE STATE WHERE INCORPORATED, WITH PERMANENT FACILITIES TO PROVIDE DIAGNOSIS AND TREATMENT FOR PATIENTS2.) TO CARRY ON ANY EDUCATION ACTIVITIES RELATED TO RENDERING CARE TO THE SICK AND INJURED, OR TO THE PROMOTION OF HEALTH3.) TO PARTICIPATE IN ANY ACTIVITY DESIGNED AND CARRIED ON TO PROMOTE THE GENERAL HEALTH OF THE COMMUNITY
IRS990.Desc: SEE SCHEDULE O:ANDERSON PHYSICIAN ALLIANCE, INC. OFFERS FAMILY PRACTICE AND SPECIALTY CLINICS TO PROVIDE QUALITY HEALTHCARE FOR EAST MISSISSIPPI AND WEST ALABAMA. THE PHYSICIANS, NURSE PRACTITIONERS AND STAFF FOCUS ON PRIMARY HEALTHCARE NEEDS OF THE COMMUNITY. DURING FISCAL YEAR 2023 , THE ORGANIZATION PROVIDED $8,048 IN CHARITY CARE TO PATIENTS. ANDERSON UROLOGY CLINIC OF MERIDIANTREATS A WIDE VARIETY OF CONDITIONS THAT AFFECT THE URINARY SYSTEM AND THE MALE REPRODUCTIVE SYSTEM.ANDERSON CARDIAC SURGICAL ASSOCIATESOFFERS A WEALTH OF KNOWLEDGE AND EXPERIENCE, MODERN SURGICAL EQUIPMENT, ADVANCED TECHNIQUES, AND HIGH-QUALITY CARE FOR COMPLEX OPEN HEART AND VASCULAR SURGERIES. PEDIATRIC HOSPITALISTSTHE PEDIATRIC HOSPITALIST OVERSEES INPATIENT TREATMENT FOR CHILDREN WHO NEED TO BE HOSPITALIZED DURING AN ACUTE ILLNESS. THIS SERVICE ENABLES FAMILIES TO STAY CLOSE TO HOME WHEN INPATIENT CARE IS REQUIRED. CHILDREN WHO NEED SUB-SPECIALTY CARE ARE TRANSFERRED TO A HIGHER LEVEL OF CARE.THE PURVIS CLINICFROM PUBERTY THROUGH CHILD-BEARING YEARS, MENOPAUSE AND BEYOND, THE PRACTICE PROVIDES PERSONAL AND HIGH QUALITY CARE FOR WOMEN. WOMEN'S MEDICAL CLINIC OF MERIDIANTHE WOMEN'S MEDICAL CLINIC OF MERIDIAN SERVE PATIENTS RANGING IN AGE FROM ADOLESCENCE TO ELDERLY, BELIEVING ALL ARE ENTITLED TO THE VERY BEST IN HEALTHCARE, UTILIZING STATE-OF-THE-ART MEDICAL TREATMENT AND SURGICAL PROCEDURES.ANDERSON PREMIER WOMEN'S CENTEROBSTETRIC AND GYNECOLOGIC SERVICES FOR WOMEN OF ALL AGES- FROM ADOLESCENCE THROUGH CHILDBEARING YEARS AND BEYOND. THE PROVIDER IS BOARD CERTIFIED BY THE AMERICAN BOARD OF OBSTETRICS AND GYNECOLOGY AND PROVIDES KNOWLEDGEABLE, COMPASSIONATE CARE THAT IS PERSONALIZED TO EACH PATIENT'S NEEDS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ANDERSON PHYSICIAN ALLIANCE IS EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL INCOME TAXES UNDER SECTION 501(A) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE AS AN ORGANIZATION DESCRIBED IN SECTION 501(C)(3); ACCORDINGLY, NO PROVISION FOR INCOME TAXES HAS BEEN MADE IN THE ACCOMPANYING CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. ACCORDINGLY, THE ACCOMPANYING CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS DO NOT REFLECT A PROVISION FOR INCOME TAXES. ANDERSON PHYSICIAN ALLIANCE HAS DETERMINED THAT IT DOES NOT HAVE ANY MATERIAL UNRECOGNIZED TAX BENEFITS OR OBLIGATIONS AS OF SEPTEMBER 30, 2023 AND 2022.
CEO, VICE PRESIDENTS AND BOARD MEMBERS ARE OFFERED FREE MEMBERSHIPS TO ANDERSON HEALTH AND FITNESSS CENTER. WANDA B. COOPER AND GEORGE D. FARR, JR. RECEIVED FREE MEMBERSHIPS.

THE ORGANIZATION IS A SUBSIDIARY OF ANDERSON REGIONAL MEDICAL CENTER (ARMC). OFFICERS AND DIRECTORS OF ANDERSON PHYSICIAN ALLIANCE INC (APA) ARE COMPENSATED BY ARMC. AS SUCH, APA FOLLOWS THE POLICIES OF ARMC. ARMC HAS A DESIGNATED THREE (3) PERSON COMMITTEE OF INDEPENDENT BOARD MEMBERS AND HAS CONTRACTED FOR AND USED THE PROFESSIONAL SERVICES OF LOCKTON FOR THE CEO AND VICE PRESIDENTS.

ARMC PROVIDES TO CERTAIN EXECUTIVES AN IRS SEC. 457(F), NON-QUALIFIED SUPPLEMENTAL RETIREMENT PLAN. THE PURPOSE OF THIS PLAN IS TO OFFER PARTICIPATING EXECUTIVES TAXABLE DEFERRED COMPENSATION BENEFITS TO SUPPLEMENT SUCH EXECUTIVE'S RETIREMENT UNDER ARMC'S TAX-QUALIFIED RETIREMENT PLAN. THE PLAN SHALL BE UNFUNDED FOR TAX PURPOSES AND FOR PURPOSE OF TITLE I OF THE EMPLOYEE RETIREMENT INCOME SECURITY ACT OF 1975 ("ERISA"). THE FOLLOWING INDIVIDUALS PARTICIPATED IN THE 457(F) PLAN: - JOHN ANDERSON $89,595 - GEORGE DENTON FARR, JR. $37,798 - STEVEN BROWN $46,423 - FRANK W. GARRISON IV $32,868 - KEITH EVERETT $53,944 - JAMES H WALLACE $60,169

IN NOVEMBER 2023, DURING DUE DILIGENCE FOR A TRANSACTION WHEREIN ANDERSON PHYSICIAN ALLIANCE ("APA") AND ITS NONPROFIT PARENT, ANDERSON REGIONAL MEDICAL CENTER, A MISSISSIPPI NON-PROFIT HOSPITAL ("ARMC"), WILL BE ACQUIRED BY BAPTIST MEMORIAL HEALTH CARE CORPORATION ("BMHCC") IN A NONPROFIT TRANSACTION, IT WAS DISCOVERED THAT APA INADVERTENTLY HAD NOT IMPLEMENTED A FORMAL CHARITY CARE POLICY IN ITS PHYSICIAN CLINICS BECAUSE THEY ARE NOT HOSPITALS SUBJECT TO INTERNAL REVENUE CODE 501(R). NEVERTHELESS, APA PROVIDES SUFFICIENT COMMUNITY BENEFIT (REV. RUL. 69-545) AS FOLLOWS: 1) APA HAS INCURRED CHARITY CARE WRITE OFFS RANGING FROM 0.13% - 0.52% OF REVENUE DURING EACH OF THE LAST SIX YEARS; 2) APA PROVIDES CARE FOR ALL PATIENTS, REGARDLESS OF ABILITY TO PAY; 3) APA IS AND HAS BEEN ENROLLED CONTINUOUSLY IN PUBLIC HEALTHCARE PROGRAMS SUCH AS MEDICAID AND MEDICARE; 4) ARMC HOSTS FREE HEALTH SCREENINGS FOR THE COMMUNITY, AND APA UROLOGISTS HAVE VOLUNTEERED AT THOSE FREE HEALTH SCREENINGS; 5) APA HAS EXPERIENCED FINANCIAL LOSSES SINCE ITS FORMATION AND PROVIDES SUBSIDIZED (BY ARMC) OUTPATIENT HEALTHCARE SERVICES TO MERIDIAN, MS A FEDERALLY-CERTIFIED HEALTH PROFESSIONAL SHORTAGE AREA AND MEDICALLY UNDERSERVED AREA; 6) APA HAS ADOPTED A CONFLICTS OF INTEREST POLICY; AND 7) APA IS DEEMED TO MAINTAIN A COMMUNITY BOARD OF DIRECTORS AS A SUBSIDIARY OF ARMC WHICH HAS A COMMUNITY BOARD. FOLLOWING THE ACQUISITION, ON JANUARY 1, 2024, APA WILL ADOPT BMHCC'S CLINIC FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE POLICY IN ALL OF ITS CLINICS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 1A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: UNLESS PROHIBITED OR LIMITED BY THE ARTICLES OF INCORPORATION OR THESE BYLAWS, THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS MAY CREATE AN EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE AND ONE OR MORE THAN OTHER COMMITTEES OF THE BOARD AND APPOINT MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS TO SERVE ON THEM.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ANDERSON REGIONAL MEDICAL CENTER (ARMC) IS THE SOLE MEMBER OF ANDERSON PHYSICIAN ALLIANCE, INC.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ANDERSON REGIONAL MEDICAL CENTER HAS THE POWER (1) TO APPOINT THE MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS, (2) TO EXERCISE ALL VOTING RIGHTS OF THE MEMBERS

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ANDERSON REGIONAL MEDICAL CENTER HAS THE POWER (1) TO APRROVE APA'S PHYSICIAN COMPENSATION MODELS, PHYSICIAN COMPENSATION AND PHYSICIAN COMPENSATION POLICIES, (2) TO APPROVE PHYSICIAN EMPLOYMENT AGREEMENTS, AND (3) TO INITIATE AND/OR APPROVE VARIOUS OTHER ACTIONS AND POLICIES AS ENUMERATED IN APA'S CERTIFICATE OF INCORPORATION AND BYLAWS, AND AS REQUIRED BY STATE LAW.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EACH BOARD MEMBER WAS PROVIDED A COPY OF THE FORM 990. THE BOARD MEMBERS WERE ASKED TO REVIEW THE FORM AND SUBMIT QUESTIONS AND COMMENTS PROIR TO THE FORM 990 BEING FINALIZED. AFTER REVIEW, THE FINALIZED FORM 990 WAS PROVIDED TO THE BOARD PRIOR TO FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION HAS A WRITTEN CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND REQUESTS ALL BOARD MEMBERS TO ANNUALLY DISCLOSE ANY POSSIBLE CONFLICTS OF INTEREST.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION IS A SUBSIDIARY OF ANDERSON REGIONAL MEDICAL CENTER (ARMC). OFFICERS AND DIRECTORS OF ANDERSON PHYSICIAN ALLIANCE (APA) ARE COMPENSATED BY ARMC. AS SUCH APA FOLLOWS THE POLICIES OF ARMC. ARMC HAS A DESIGNATED THREE PERSON COMMITTEE OF INDEPENDENT BOARD MEMBERS AND HAS CONTRACTED FOR AND USED THE PROFESSIONAL SERVICES OF LOCKTON FOR THE CEO AND VICE PRESIDENTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 18
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: IN ADDITION, RECENT FILINGS OF THE FORM 990 ARE MADE AVAILABLE ONLINE AT WWW.GUIDESTAR.ORG.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ARTICLES OF INCORPORATION ARE ON FILE AND ARE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC AT THE MISSISSIPPI SECRETARY OF STATE'S OFFICE. THE BYLAWS AND THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY ARE NOT PUBLICLY AVAILABLE. THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC AS A PART OF THE 990 FORM AS CONSOLIDATED FINANCIALS OF ARMC.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, LINE 1: INDEPENDENCE OF VOTING BOARD MEMBERS:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION IS A SUBSIDIARY OF ANDERSON REGIONAL MEDICAL CENTER, A 501(C)(3) ORGANIZATION. THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS OF THIS ORGANIZATION FAILS TO HAVE A MAJORITY OF INDEPENDENT BOARD MEMBERS PER THE DEFINITION PROVIDED BY THE IRS. PLEASE NOTE, HOWEVER, THAT THE SOLE MEMBER ORGANIZATION HAS A FIFTY PERCENT INDEPENDENT BOARD OF DIRECTORS, AND THROUGH ITS MEMBERSHIP PROVIDES GOVERNANCE OVERSIGHT OVER THE FILING ORGANIZATION. PLEASE SEE THE RESPONSES TO FORM 990, PART VI, LINES 6 THROUGH 7B FOR DETAILS ON THE SOLE MEMBER AND ITS AUTHORITY.
THE PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.
